block.p: Eating Locally

Tomorrow at 6:30 p.m., at the Great Hall of the Cooper Union, 7 East Seventh Street, Barbara Kingsolver will talk about her book ''Animal, Vegetable, Miracle: A Year of Food Life'' (HarperCollins, 2007), which discusses her family's year of eating only food grown locally, in Virginia. Tickets, which benefit the New York Restoration Project, are $10 from (212) 279-4200 or ticketcentral.com.
Where There's Salt

The first Salt Expo, with seminars, a marketplace, salt-based meals and other activities, will be held tomorrow through Sunday in Naples, Italy. Information is available at saltexpo.com. The next Salt Expo will be held in San Francisco in 2008.
Chocolate Tour
Culinary Insiders is holding a tour of chocolatiers in downtown Manhattan on Saturday from 1 to 4 p.m., starting with lunch at HQ, 90 Thompson Street (Spring Street).
The fee is $100 for members, $120 for nonmembers: (212) 330-9080 or culinaryinsiders.com.
Comedy Benefit

Just Food, an organization that runs the C.S.A. (Community Supported Agriculture) program in New York City, which brings seasonal produce from farms to subscribers, will hold a benefit, Just Kidding, on Monday at 8 p.m. at the Gotham Comedy Club, 208 West 23rd Street. Tickets are $35 to $1,000: www.justfood.org. Tickets at $40 will be sold at the door, if available: (212) 645-9880, ext. 221.
Catalan Spring

In spring the Catalonia region of Spain is filled with the aroma of grilling green onions that are like leeks, a tradition called the calçotada. On Tuesday at Savoy, 70 Prince Street (Crosby Street), there will be a calçotada dinner, with lamb chops, sausages and rosé wine, $75: (212)219-8570.
Beer Dinner
A four-course beer dinner with a reception will be held on May 10 at 7 p.m. at Southampton Publick House, 40 Bowden Square, Southampton, N.Y. The fee is $60 plus tax and tip: (631) 283-2800.
Wine Tastings

A tasting of cult cabernet sauvignon wines from California, with cheeses and pâtés, will be held tomorrow from 7 to 9 p.m. It is sponsored by New York Wine Guild, an educational group, and will be held at 269 11th Avenue (27th Street). The cost is $300: www.newyorkwineguild.com.

Tastings of wines from the Southern Hemisphere will be held on Tuesday from 7:15 to 8:45 and 9 to 10:30 p.m. at Bacchus Wine Made Simple, 2056 Broadway (70th Street). Tickets, $40 plus tax: (212) 875-1200 or bacchusnyc.com.

Most of the 40 wineries on Long Island will pour their wares at a tasting on May 16 from 6 to 9 p.m. at BAM Café, at the Brooklyn Academy of Music, 30 Lafayette Avenue (Ashland Place), Fort Greene, Brooklyn. Tickets, $30: brownpapertickets.com.
Maryland Seafood Festivals

A directory of spring and summer seafood festivals in Maryland is available at marylandseafood.org or by sending a stamped, self-addressed envelope to 2007 Seafood Festival List, Maryland Department of Agriculture, Seafood Marketing Program, 50 Harry S. Truman Parkway, Annapolis, Md. 21401.
